com.ziluck.factions

Class Factions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bukkit.plugin.PluginBase
      • org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin
        • com.ziluck.factions.Factions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CommandExecutor, TabCompleter, TabExecutor, Plugin

    public class Factions
extends JavaPlugin
    The base plugin for Factions.

    This class has a ton of convenience methods for retrieving things from the default FactionStore. Although it is not required, it is simpler to just use the static convenience methods within here.

    Author:
    Michael Ziluck

      • getInstance

        public static Factions getInstance()
        Retrieves the current singleton instance of Factions. It is important to note that this is set in the onEnable(), so all other plugins must have a dependency or soft-dependency for Factions for this to be reliable.
        Returns:
        the current singleton instance of Factions.

      • getFaction

        public static Faction getFaction(long id)
        Gets a Faction referenced by its id. If one is not found, this will return null.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the Faction.
        Returns:
        the Faction if one exists.

      • getFaction

        public static Faction getFaction(String name)
        Gets a Faction referenced by its name. If one is not found, this will return null.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Faction.
        Returns:
        the Faction if one exists.

      • getFaction

        public static Faction getFaction(UUID uuid)
        Gets a Faction referenced by a player's UUID. If the user is not found, this will return null. If the User has no faction, this will return the Wilderness.
        Parameters:
        uuid - the uuid of the Player.
        Returns:
        the Faction if one exists.

      • getFaction

        public static Faction getFaction(Location location)
        Gets a Faction that has a claim at a particular Location. If one is not found, this will return Wilderness, not null.
        Parameters:
        location - the location of the faction.
        Returns:
        the Faction if one exists.

      • getFaction

        public static Faction getFaction(LazyLocation location)
        Gets a Faction that has a claim at a particular LazyLocation. If one is not found, this will return Wilderness, not null.
        Parameters:
        location - the location of the faction.
        Returns:
        the Faction if one exists.

      • getFaction

        public static Faction getFaction(BlockColumn column)
        Gets a Faction that has a claim at a particular BlockColumn. If one is not found, this will return Wilderness, not null.
        Parameters:
        column - the BlockColumn of the faction.
        Returns:
        the Faction if one exists.

      • getFactions

        public static List<Faction> getFactions(BoundedArea area)
        Gets all Factions that have claims within the given bounded area. If one is not found, this returns an EMPTY List; it will not return a List with the Wilderness in it. This method will never return null.
        Parameters:
        area - the area to search within.
        Returns:
        all Factions if any exist.

      • getFaction

        public static Faction getFaction(User user)
        Gets the Faction of the given User. If one is not found, this will return Wilderness, not null.
        Parameters:
        user - the user.
        Returns:
        the Faction if one exists.

      • getFaction

        public static Faction getFaction(Player player)
        Gets the Faction of the given Player. If one is not found, this will return Wilderness, not null.
        Parameters:
        player - the player.
        Returns:
        the Faction if one exists.

      • getUser

        public static User getUser(UUID uuid)
        Gets the User with the given UUID. If one is not found, this will return null.
        Parameters:
        uuid - the uuid of the User.
        Returns:
        the User with the given UUID.

      • broadcastMessage

        public static void broadcastMessage(String... messages)
        Broadcast a message to all players.

        This is the same as calling Bukkit.broadcastMessage(String) for all the messages in the list.

        Parameters:
        messages - the messages
